newsitem.title: GERMANY: German shares end bourse at record closing high.
newsitem.headline: German shares end bourse at record closing high.

text.p: German shares ended bourse trade at a record closing high on Friday after catching up with the rally that occurred post-bourse Thursday following U.S. data that calmed market fears of a U.S. interest rate increase.
The DAX-30 index of leading German shares ended at 2,933.39 points, up 40.76 points or 1.41 point higher. The previous year high was 2,914.61 points on December 5 last year.

The record close reflected the surge in stocks on the Dow Jones index overnight, which closed up 1.16 percent at 6,625.67 points and represented a strong recovery from pre-bourse electronic trade, when the IBIS DAX index fell after Japan's Nikkei-225 share index fell 4.3 percent.

The DAX index ended comfortably above the psychologically-important 2,900-point level and the strong dollar at 1.5785 marks was seen as supporting share values. Investor focus afterwards centred on U.S. jobs data due 1330 GMT.
The close at 2,933.39 points put the DAX within sight of the magic 3,000-point level.

The main share in the news was the carmaker Volkswagen AG, which ended up 21.50 marks at 712 marks in mid-bourse trade after it announced it had reached a settlement with General Motors in the long-running legal dispute between the two.
Another German carmaker, BMW AG, ended up 25 marks at 1,078 marks on positive expectations on the group's earnings in 1996.
